thread.title: Youth football: Little Warriors sweep Sanborn by combined score fo 94-6
thread.title_full: Youth football: Little Warriors sweep Sanborn by combined score fo 94-6

author: Staff Reports sports@seacoastonline.com
title: Youth football: Little Warriors sweep Sanborn by combined score fo 94-6
text: Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 10:23 AM By Staff Reports Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 10:23 AM Â» Social News The following are game summaries from last weekend's play in the Little Warriors youth football program. Information is provided by the coaches. Pee Wee A The Little Warriors improved to 6-0 with a 38-0 win over Sanborn. The offense combined for 250 yards rushing and five touchdowns led by running backs Tucker McCann, Chris Capezzuto, Owen Bateman and quarterback Kyle Tilley. All scores were made possible by the upfront blocking from Ben McClelland, Thomas MacDougall, Bodey Reed, Kolby Blaisdell, Tyler Parkinson, Jack McCann and Cam MacHardy. Defensively, Matt Alkire, Dominic Gould, Nico Zaino, Zach Fredericks, Colin Harrington, illey and Jack McCann all had four tackles, while Joe Larrabee and Levon McCann both had three. Larrabee and Jack McCann each had a fumble recovery. The Little Warriors will play in Tewksbury, Mass. on Saturday in their final game of the regular season. Pee Wee B Kevin Tilley and Frank Brown both had two touchdowns, and Aidan McErlain and Conor Fenlon both had one as the Little Warriors beat Sanborn, 56-6 and improved to 5-0-1 on the season. Lebron Miller had two 2-point conversion receptions. All yards and touchdowns were made possible by the Warriors' offensive line, led by Quinn MacNeil, Jason Pinsonnault, Ben Goodwin, Brandon Matheson, Tony Johnson, Jake Fredericks, Miller and Nolan Perkins. Defensively, Perkins, Miller, Brown, Coner Blaisdell, James Robillard, Pinsonnault, Matthew Mattimore, Fredericks, Quinn MacNeil, Braylon Knowles, Elijah Garofalo, David Bagley and Ben Companero. This win was a total team effort. The Little Warriors will play in Tewksbury, Mass. on Saturday in their final game of the regular season.
